Usage

Usage

Before starting, be sure to have defined the PLAY2_HOME system variable used by the plugin to find the Play 2 SDK. The packaging of your project must be play2.

export PLAY2_HOME=...
# or
mvn clean install -DPLAY2_HOME=...

Best practice is to define the version of the Play2 plugin that you want to use in either your pom.xml or a parent pom.xml.

<project>
    [...]
    <build>
        <pluginManagement>
            <plugins>
                <plugin>
                    <groupId>de.akquinet.innovation.play2</groupId>
                    <artifactId>play2-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
                </plugin>
            </plugins>
        </pluginManagement>
    </build>
    [...]
</project>

To use the maven-play2-plugin Plugin, you need to add the following configuration to your pom.xml

<project>
    [...]
    <packaging>play2</packaging>
    [...]
    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>de.akquinet.innovation.play2</groupId>
                <artifactId>play2-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    [...]
</project>

The maven-play2-plugin Plugin is invoked during the:

  • process-resources phase : copy dependencies to the lib directory
  • compile phase: compile the play 2 application
  • test phase: run tests
  • package phase: build the application package

    A full run, execute all those steps:

    mvn clean install
